TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IXpsFixedPageWriter implements class System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IStoryFragmentProvider

Docs.summary: Defines methods for writing parts to an XPS document.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedDocumentWriter.AddFixedPage%2A> method to obtain a fixed-page writer for adding pages to an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument>.
[!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddDocContent](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CPP/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateadddoccontent)] [!code-csharp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddDocContent](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CSharp/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateadddoccontent)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddDocContent](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/visualbasic/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateadddoccontent)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddColorContext%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsColorContext> to the document package and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.

Docs.returns: The new font resource that was added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddFont%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsFont> to the document package and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddFont%2A> method to add a font resource to a page.
[!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CPP/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-csharp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CSharp/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/visualbasic/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateaddpageresources)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsFont AddFont(bool obfuscate) cil managed
Public Function AddFont (obfuscate As Boolean) As XpsFont

Docs.summary: Adds a new obfuscated to the current page.
Docs.returns: The new font resource that was added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddFont%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsFont> with optional obfuscation to the document package and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.
Set the `obfuscate` parameter to `true` when you are legally obligated to obfuscate a licensed proprietary font. While obfuscation does not encrypt the font, it inhibits unzipping proprietary fonts and installing them separately for other uses.
For more information about font obfuscation, see Section 2.1.7.3 "Embedded Font Obfuscation" in the *XML Paper Specification (XPS)* available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddFont%2A> method in order to add a font resource to a page.
[!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CPP/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-csharp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CSharp/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/visualbasic/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateaddpageresources)]

Docs.param: to prevent modification of any text that uses the font; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Adds a new obfuscated or restricted to the current page.
Docs.returns: The new font resource that was added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddFont%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsFont> with optional obfuscation or restrictions to the document package, and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.
Set the `obfuscate` parameter to `true` when you are legally obligated to obfuscate a licensed proprietary font. While obfuscation does not encrypt the font, it inhibits unzipping proprietary fonts and installing them separately for other uses.
For more information about font obfuscation and the use of restricted fonts see the *XML Paper Specification (XPS)* available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddFont%2A> method to add a font resource to a page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddImage%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImage> with a specified `mimeType` to the document package and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImage AddImage(valuetype System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImageType imageType) cil managed
Public Function AddImage (imageType As XpsImageType) As XpsImage

Docs.param: The type of image to add to the page.
Docs.summary: Adds a new with a specified to the current page.
Docs.returns: The new image resource that was added to the page

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddImage%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImage> with the specified <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImageType> to the document package and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.
For example, `imageType` can be <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImageType.JpegImageType> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImageType.PngImageType>. to add a JPEG or PNG <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImage>, respectively.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddImage%2A> method to add an image resource to a page.
[!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CPP/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-csharp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CSharp/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/visualbasic/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateaddpageresources)]

The absolute path of the resource to add, or .
Docs.summary: Adds a new to the current page.
Docs.returns: The new [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] resource that was added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddResource%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsResource> to the document package, and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.
If `resourceUri` is `null`, a unique resource <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.Uri%2A> is automatically created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddResourceDictionary%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsResourceDictionary> to the document package and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsThumbnail AddThumbnail(valuetype System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImageType imageType) cil managed
Public Function AddThumbnail (imageType As XpsImageType) As XpsThumbnail

Docs.param: The image type of the thumbnail image to add to the page.
Docs.summary: Adds a thumbnail image of a specified to the current page.
Docs.returns: The new thumbnail image resource that was added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.AddThumbnail%2A> adds a new <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImageType> to the document package and associates it with the current <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.
For example, `imageType` can be <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImageType.JpegImageType> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsImageType.PngImageType>. to add a JPEG or PNG thumbnail image, respectively.

Docs.exception: has already been called to add an image thumbnail for this page.

block.para: Each page can only contain with one thumbnail. An is thrown if is called to add more than one thumbnail image for the page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Commit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Flushes and closes the fixed-page writer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Based on settings of <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationManager> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsPackagingPolicy>, such as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.FontSubsetterCommitPolicies> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackageInterleavingOrder>, the flush operation of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.Commit%2A> method may be delayed until the complete <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> is closed.
## Examples The following example shows how to flush and close the fixed-page writer with the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.Commit%2A> method.
[!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddDocContent](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CPP/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateadddoccontent)] [!code-csharp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddDocContent](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/CSharp/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateadddoccontent)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddDocContent](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsCreate/visualbasic/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateadddoccontent)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LinkTargetStream As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: Gets a list of strings that identify the hyperlink points that are contained in the current page.
Docs.value: A list of strings that identify the hyperlink points that are contained in the page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The list of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LinkTarget> hyperlink points is available after the page has been written and the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.Commit%2A> method has been called.
For information about <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LinkTarget> elements see Section 3.2.3 "\<LinkTarget> Element" in the *XML Paper Specification (XPS)* available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PageNumber As Integer
public: property int PageNumber { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the zero-based page number of this page.
Docs.value: The zero-based page number of this page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.PageNumber%2A> property returns the zero-based page number for this <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> of the document. (<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.IXpsFixedPageWriter.PageNumber%2A> value of zero is the first page.)
